title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics win 111-107 against the Magic, led by Luka Garza's 16 points and eight rebounds in 17 minutes.
Jordan Walsh contributed defensively and hit crucial shots, including a key 3-pointer with 13 seconds left.
Anfernee Simons scored 25 points, all in the first half, helping build an early lead against Orlando.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signed a new contract to remain with the Boston Red Sox as game-planning and run prevention coach.
Varitek has served in various roles with Boston since 2012 and was a catcher for the team from 1997 to 2011.
Varitek expressed confidence in the team's future, highlighting the potential of players like catcher Carlos Narvaez.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson combined for three touchdowns in a 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers.
TreVeyon Henderson recorded two scores and reached 22.01 mph, a top speed for a rookie ball carrier this season.
New England's offensive line, anchored by rookies Will Campbell and Jared Wilson, allowed only one sack in the game.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye leads NFL MVP odds on FanDuel with +250, outperforming Josh Allen and Patrick Mahomes.
In a win against Tampa Bay, Maye threw 270 yards, two touchdowns, despite an interception.
Maye has 2,555 passing yards, 19 touchdowns, 71.7% completion rate, and rushed 283 yards this season.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski to sign a one-day contract with the Patriots, officially retiring as a member of the team.
Gronkowski spent nine seasons with the Patriots, winning three Super Bowls and setting franchise records in receiving touchdowns.
Gronkowski now co-hosts a podcast with Julian Edelman and works for Fox Sports after retiring from the NFL in 2022.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams scored crucial touchdowns in a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Elijah Ponder recorded his first career sack, contributing to New England's victory, while Jack Gibbens registered ten tackles.
Tight ends Austin Hooper and Hunter Henry underperformed, combining for just one catch in the game.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams scored three touchdowns in a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Drake Maye completed 16-of-31 passes for 270 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception; Patriots extend win streak to seven.
Coach Mike Vrabel's clock management helped orchestrate a crucial double-score surge, securing a lead before halftime.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga charged with drunk driving after crashing into a pole on Oct. 19.
Daveiga arrested after Massachusetts State Police found his Jeep on the curb at Leverett Circle, Boston.
Placed on 'modified duty', Daveiga pleaded not guilty and is set to return to court Dec. 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash workers with work permits remain in federal custody after a Nov. 4 ICE raid.
ICE allegedly denied employees the chance to retrieve documents and reportedly mistreated some detainees.
Rep. Ayanna Pressley and local officials voiced support and are assisting detained workers' families.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on Nov. 8, with musical guest Sombr.
Glaser gained fame after a standout performance at the 2024 Tom Brady roast.
Pete Davidson returned to the 'Weekend Update' desk during Glaser's 'SNL' episode.
